text.0:
Lai Mohammed recently claimed that the reason Nigeria is still battling insecurity and terrorism is because global partners have blocked Nigeria’s weapon purchase. Is this true? 

 Read the facts here: https://t.co/v5mqZBOtmp #DubawaChecks https://t.co/enHwpozujo
text.1: Reno Omokri's claim that President Muhammadu Buhari budgeted N3.2 billion for food and travel for 2020 is false. We also fact-checked his claims about increased fuel price and the exchange rate. Read the facts here: https://t.co/aAS7bT5vFt #DubawaChecks
text.2: The second wave of #Covid19 is here, and along with it, a mutation of the coronavirus. How will this mutation in virus affect the efficacy of the new vaccine and how prepared is Nigeria for the second wave? Read here to get all the facts: https://t.co/pDlzMAQ3rl #DubawaChecks
text.3: A viral post on Twitter claims President Buhari visited Kankara in Katsina State where hundreds of secondary school students were kidnapped, two days after the incident but there is no evidence substantiating the claim. Read here: https://t.co/z4I9vP5lvo #DubawaChecks
